alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 1:10PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and northeast Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In northeast Arizona, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 109 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tees Toh Wash, Little Colorado River, Bidahochi Wash, Steamboat Wash, Polacca Wash, Coyote Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash, Jeddito Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash and Beshbito Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tees Toh, Seba Dalkai, Cedar Springs, Dilkon, White Cone, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 376 and 393. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
